usefulItems: baking tray, pastry brush, rolling pin, cling film, oven
title: Khachapuri

ingredients.content: 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
1 tsp fine sea salt, plus extra to taste

preparations.content: Place yeast, sugar and water in mixing bowl then heat <b>2 min/45°C/speed 1<b>. Leave to stand for 10 minutes.
Add flour, oil and salt then knead <b>3 min/<b>. Transfer to a lightly-greased bowl, cover with cling film and leave in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes).
Preheat oven to 220°C and warm a baking tray for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Place Havarti cheese in mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl, add feta, then combine and set aside.

Knock down dough and divide in 2. On a lightly-floured work surface, roll dough out into Ø 25 cm circles approx. 3 mm thick. Divide spinach between the 2 circles and sprinkle half the cheese mixture over dough, leaving a 1.5 cm border around the edge.

Starting at one side of 1 circle, tightly roll the dough ⅓ of the way toward the centre. Repeat on the opposite end to leave a gap of 5-7 cm between the two rolls. Repeat with second circle. Pinch each end of the rolls together and twist to seal, making a boat shape. Finish by dividing remaining cheese mixture between the pastries.
Transfer to warm baking tray and bake for 14-16 minutes (220°C) until golden brown.

Crack 1 egg into centre of each boat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Return to oven for 4-5 minutes, until egg is just set. With a pastry brush, brush edges with melted butter and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: This cheese-filled bread is a traditional dish of Georgia.
This recipe can easily be doubled.
Semi-hard cow's milk such as Monterey Jack or Provolone may be used in place of Havarti.
